sections.title: Market Pulse: Cautious Optimism After Friday's Rebound

items.headline: U.S. Futures Show Mixed Sentiment Following Friday's Strong Close
items.summary: U.S. equity futures are indicating a cautious start to the week, following a robust rebound on Friday, February 6th, which saw major indices recover from a three-day tech sell-off. Investors are digesting recent market dynamics, including a rotation towards value and economically sensitive sectors observed in early February. While no definitive pre-market data is immediately available for all major indices this morning, the market is poised to open with a focus on upcoming economic data and evolving sector trends.

items.headline: Nvidia Leads Tech Rebound
items.summary: Shares of AI darling Nvidia surged significantly on Friday, contributing to the tech sector's recovery.

items.headline: MicroStrategy Jumps with Bitcoin Rebound
items.summary: Bitcoin treasury firm MicroStrategy saw a substantial jump as Bitcoin rebounded after a recent tumble.

items.headline: Amazon Slides on Capex Concerns
items.summary: Amazon.com stock declined following a disappointing earnings report and plans for significant AI infrastructure spending.

items.headline: Molina Healthcare Plunges Post-Earnings
items.summary: Molina Healthcare was among the notable decliners on Friday after its earnings report.

items.headline: Sector Rotation Continues Amid Broadening Rally
items.summary: January's market saw a significant 'Great Rotation' from mega-cap technology to small-cap domestic stocks, with Energy, Materials, Consumer Staples, and Industrials emerging as leading sectors. This trend suggests a broadening of the market rally beyond the narrow tech-led gains of the previous year. Concerns around elevated tech valuations and AI capital expenditure commitments persist.

items.headline: Federal Reserve to Release Weekly Financial Data Today
items.summary: The Federal Reserve is scheduled to release its H.8 report on 'Assets and Liabilities of Commercial Banks in the U.S.' at 4:15 p.m. ET today, February 8, 2026. Additionally, Commercial Paper data is also slated for release.

items.headline: Federal Reserve Finalizes 2026 Stress Test Scenarios
items.summary: On February 4th, the Federal Reserve finalized the scenarios for its 2026 stress tests. These scenarios include a projected rise in the unemployment rate to 10%, severe market volatility, widening corporate bond spreads, and a significant decline in asset prices, including a 30% drop in house prices and a 39% decline in commercial real estate prices.
